Reviews.Title: “a nice place to be”
Reviews.Author: hypo23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of Days Inns in seven or so states of United States and found this Days Hotel to be a rather pleasant place to be. I treated it as a base to come back to as a sort of an interuption to my real reason for being in Boston - ie. a historical fact finding holiday - and I found this hotel quite suitable for my purposes. One of the front desk men John, actually took me on a sorty to a local park where he and his fellow "Birders" showed me some local wildlife while they photographed them for local magazines. Now, if that is not going out of their way to show a international traveller how to enjoy the local community, then I don't know how they could have topped that. Well done John and thankyou to the other helpfully members of the Days staff. The room was good and the oportunity to enjoy a nice restaurant was also within the building. I slept really well while at this hotel and enjoyed some good television in a pleasant room with a good view out the window of the parklands across the road. I stayed during winter and the heating was cofortable for me. The roomstaff were also pleasant. I would recommend this place to other people of like mind.

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Dale B
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a HUGE favor - DO NOT stay at this hotel. The entire premises including the hallways and the room stunk like a cross between a nursing home and a futile attempt to chemically cover up the odor. The furniture was outdated and all scuffed up, the elevator jerked and skipped at every start and stop and overall, the place was just plain filthy. After inspecting our room, we went to the front desk to explain that we could not stay here (because my wife and daughter got ill from the smells), the attendant immediately changed his demeanor and accused us of somehow scamming the hotel and told us to "get out, leave, goodbye, go back to where you came from". This person would not give us his name and was the most rudest, untrained and pathetic hospitality employee we've EVER met. If you like the feeling of slime and the smell of rancid meat, urine and vomit, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Once you get to your room...”
Reviews.Author: MvanH
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here some time ago, this isn't quite what I remembered. Filthy elevators and a hallway with a foul smell that I can't quite place... Odd, like somewhat was eating fried fish an hour ago. This business center at which I am now writing looks like it has a computer (just 1 for a 4 story hotel?) from the 1990's. Once in the room, it seemed fairly clean and well made up. The room is supposed to be nonsmoking, but that seems to mean that they air it out and fumigate after people smoke (which is different if you suffer allergies). If you are someone who can tolerate mustiness, OK... but if you are sensitive or finicky, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: Keith T
Reviews.Content: This hotel stinks like farts and cigarette butts. After following outdated signs to the back of the hotel on my floor to find a vending machine that wasn't there, I headed back down to the first floor. The desk guy came out and interrupted me on my cellphone to ask me suspiciously if I was "lost" when I was in the back part of the hotel, apparently watching me on camera........as if I was casing the joint. Creepy. You might think it's a deal.....pay the extra 20 bucks to stay elsewhere........it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and good value if you don't mind being out of the way!”
Reviews.Author: Cla2401
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money but you do have to get a bus and a subway to get into Boston and buses at night aren't very regular. The area felt a bit isolated and I wouldn't have liked to wander much at night. The room was spacious if a little dated and musty smelling. Service was good, we were able to check in early. Only a Chinese restaurant attached to the hotel but a nice breakfast diner just across the street. Nearby Cambridge has lots of nice places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Find a different hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mazaral8
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very dirty, old, and smelled. The room itself was spacious, but the bathroom was tiny! I had to do my hair and makeup using the mirror in the main room. The bathroom also had dust and a filmy substance in various places and appeared as if it hadn't been cleaned in months. Parking was nearly impossible to find during the evening (there is a restaurant attached that uses the hotels parking). When returning from dinner we were unable to find a spot. We asked at the front desk and they told us to park illegally in the lot next door (that had big signs saying they would tow cars) and then move it later when people left the restaurant. My husband had to make three trips to check for spots before he finally found a parking spot in the hotel lot that we had paid for. Also, at the back of the hotel where the parking lot is, there was a entrance door that had no lock or "hotel key" entrance. Basically anyone could have come in that door. I would not recommend this hotel, and I will never be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel, horrible smelling rooms”
Reviews.Author: thenork
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is located a convenient walk from harvard, it is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. The room we were given smelled of horribly strong bathroom cleanser, but not just in the bathroom but everywhere. You can only open the windows a tiny bit, so that didn't help. When I went to call downstairs, I thankfully noticed that there was some bit of food or something on the mouthpiece of the phone receiver. We were shown 4 additional rooms, which all either stunk like the cleaning solvent or else cigarette smoke. We threatened to leave, and they said if we did, they would still charge us for the room. We settled when they gave us a larger suite which had only the cigarette smell. The elevator also smelled and didn't work sometimes, and the beds had lint on them.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not great”
Reviews.Author: Murdocki
Reviews.Content: The Day's Inn is not elegant or fancy. But it is reasonably priced and well located. The walk to Harvard Square is about 20 minutes. There is a great diner - The Breakfast Club - located closeby. The facility was clean and pleasant. The room amenities were great (in terms of variety), but the bathroom had a distinct smell of cleaning supplies. It was not visibly dirty but the smell did not inspire cleanliness. Service was not so great, both times I stopped by the reception I had to wait for people to get off the phone. Free internet and parking was great. The area where the hotel is located was sketchy but it's an okay place to stay for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok. Scuffed furniture, crowded parking due to restaurant, skating rink”
Reviews.Author: Armypeople
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok. A disappointment that such a great location does not keep their hotel fresh and up to date. The room was drab, scuffed furniture, curtains not correct on the rod, rust on the bathroom ceiling and air vent in the room. Old TV, lower mattress was uncovered and stained on the side that showed when you pulled back the comforter. It was a good place to just shut your eyes but not part of the Harvard University visiting experience. Parking is free but there is a popular asian restaurant in the lobby of the hotel and a skating rink next door which took over the parking until 9 pm. Entire lobby smells like authentic asian restaurant and waiting diners (not hotel guests) fill the lobby. It is a good hotel for closing your eyes and sleeping in. Ihop is down the street on Soldiers Field Drive for breakfast and Starbucks too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: NomadForLife
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand what everyone is complaining about. The Days is a wonderful hotel for the money. Yes, it is in Allston-Brighton, a bit far out from downtown, but that is not the Days fault, it is up to you to figure out if the cost/ distance ratio and decide if it is worth it for you. I stayed at this hotel for a night in April of 2008 for the sole purpose of sleep. And, at $120.00, you can't beat it. All I care about when I travel is cleanliness and the room was clean, dated, yes, but clean. The distance was not a problem for me as I had a car. Hotel parking is a covered lot and is FREE, very uncommon in Boston. I am a Boston regular and will be moving there end of year for Graduate school, so I am familiar with the areas, and can attest that the neighborhood, while sparse, is perfectly safe. If you are like me and would rather spend your money enjoying Boston rather than waste it on a fancy hotel, then the Days is perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “Older but clean”
Reviews.Author: maxpower212
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a good place to spend a night. The staff was very friendly. Maybe a little brief, and quick, but that may just be a Southerner's experience in Boston. The hotel itself looked relatively old, and not in the charming, historic, Boston way. It was obvious once I was inside that this wasn't just on the outside. The room was definitely older, but very clean, with "upgraded" shampoo and lotion. The New England coffee (roasted in MA) was also a nice touch, especially for tourists, although you can only do so much with a pre-packaged bag of ground coffee. There were maybe 15 channels on the TV, including HBO, and free wi-fi in the room. My room (two doubles) also had a desk and three chairs. The bed was relatively firm, although not uncomfortable, and there was a thermostat that controlled the heat, but not the A/C. The fan in the exhaust duct rattled during startup and shutdown, but otherwise wasn't too loud. I had a room that was adjacent to Soldiers Field Rd., and you could hear cars passing by pretty easily when the heater wasn't on. If you're a light sleeper, or if you were trying to sleep during off hours, I could see that being a problem. Additionally, there is a Chinese restaurant downstairs that smelled good and appeared popular with the local Asian crowd, even on Tuesday night, but I didn't go in. Other Miscellaneous Information: The hotel backs up to Western Ave., which can be useful if you're walking or busing it. For the frugal, there are several bus routes there (70,86) that will take you into Cambridge, to Harvard, and to the Red Line. There are a few Zipcars within walking distance as well. From the airport, you can take public transit right to the hotel for a total of $3.50 or less, and in about an hour or so.

Reviews.Title: “Stealing while you're sleeping!!”
Reviews.Author: emak2323
Reviews.Content: This was a horrible experience - some friends and I wanted to book a hotel for a night out for my birthday. During the middle of the night, someone acquired a key to our room, came in and robbed us blind. We lost $1500 worth of things with no retribution. DON'T STAY HERE IF YOU VALUE YOUR THINGS AND SAFETY!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place, but stay away from the pool !”
Reviews.Author: Chouin
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two weeks in July and almost everything was ok. The chinese restaurant in the hotel was very very good and the staff (hotel and restaurant) were friendly. It is a good place to stay near from Boston at a good price. It is easy to reach Boston with the Bus and the T. You only have to take the Bus # 86 on Western avenue to Harvard Square, and there, take the T (subway). 10 minutes in Bus or 30 minutes walking to harvard Square. So, as I said before, almost everything was ok. The problem, if you go there in summer, is the smell at the outside pool that comes from the garbage container (Chinese restaurant) that is next to the pool fence. It is very disgusting ! On the other hand, you can have the pool only for you because nobody go there ! The elevator has the same odour !

Reviews.Title: “Bad, bad, bad”
Reviews.Author: rita1962Piacenza
Reviews.Content: I'm the same who, last year wrote a lot of wonderful things abou this hotel. Much to my regret, this year I went back to this hotel and I have to write so different things it's impossible to believe. We were 7 people and we had a reservation for 3 rooms for 7 nights (from 14 to 21 Aug.). I led these friends of mine in this hotel but I had to be very repentant and sorry for the choice. We arrived late in the evening and at the front-desk, they were non-collaborative (and, sometimes, quite ill-bred). They gave us the (3) keys for the rooms without any explanation: rooms were in an annex place, not easy to find as no information were available. We had to reach the rooms with our luggages throw a long way and stairs. Rooms were in the back, they had horrible view. The rooms were clean enough, but nothing special. The phone in the room was out of service (without a notice). It's unfathomable to me how a property like this may be in such a hotel class... may be just for the front rooms but the hotel could not in any way be described as a quality place to stay. It is definately low budget. The price is good but, next time, I'm sure I'll find a better stay at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Teebobs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. During our stay we actually considered getting another hotel. The hallways were dark and dirty and the elevator was disgusting and smelled like urine. The room itself didn't look bad but I wasn't comfortable walking around without my shoes. The shower had a mat and underneath the mat, there was a thick layer of mold. We were placed in the "annex" part of the hotel- their addition in the back. I never saw anyone walking the halls or heard people talking which gave me an eerie feeling. Even though the price was a steal for somewhere in Boston, I would rather pay a little extra and be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose”
Reviews.Author: Nomadic_Female
Reviews.Content: First off, there are two "Days" in Allston-Brighton, one is an "Inn" (which I read got really unfavorable reviews) and the other, this one, is a "Hotel" located on Soldier's Field Road. Just to avoid any confusion! I stayed at this Hotel on April 24, 2008. I took my dad to see a Red Sox game and needed to find a reasonable place to sleep. I couldn't afford a $300 a night hotel in Downtown after paying $200 for Sox tickets! I don't really care about frills, all I look for is cleanliness and a safe neighborhood. The front desk was very nice and they let us check-in early. The total cost for one night was $123.00 for two double beds including tax. I realize I rated the Days as "Excellent", and it was, for what it was needed for, to sleep. I can't comment on much else except the room as that's all I used the Hotel for, but the room was clean. I thoroughly inspected my sheets before climbing into bed! The bathroom was dated but clean. Very basic amenities; TV, phone, toiletries, hair dryer and a coffee maker. It is located in Allston-Brighton about 3 miles from the heart of Boston. So, you shouldn't be surprised that its far out, a simple Mapquest of the address will tell you just how far it is. The distance didn't bother me because I had a car which I took and parked in Downtown the next day. The Hotel parking is free, something you don't get in a lot of Downtown Boston Hotels. We did, however, take a cab to Fenway because it was easier to do so. Parking can cost upwards of $30 and driving to Fenway on game day can be a hassle, the cab cost $16 each way (not including tip). The neighborhood is very sparse, but the Hotel felt safe and I felt ok leaving my car parked in their covered lot. I saw a bus stop right across the street from the Hotel, I can't be sure, but perhaps it takes you to Downtown or at least the nearest T-stop. Overall, if you just need a clean bed and don't mind the drive to Downtown, then its just fine and the money you save you can spend enjoying Boston rather than sleeping it away!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: lsnhc
Reviews.Content: I was in the Boston area on business and wanted to have dinner with my son, a student at BC, so something in the vicinity was a real plus. Unfortunately, reasonably priced lodging options in the Newton/Chestnut Hill vicinity are virtually non-existent. Not wanting to spend the $200+ for a night at the Newton Sheraton, I figured that even if Days Hotel wasn't terribly good, it was only one night. Make no mistake - it is not a luxury lodging, nor does it represent itself to be, and the location is, well, rather weird. All of that being said, my room was clean, very spacious, and definitely doable for a night (or for that matter, maybe a few nights), and the $99 paid on Hotwire was a bargain compared to other options. I did not try the Chinese restaurant onsite, so I cannot comment on that, but in my opinion, for a "budget" lodging, the facility is in reasonably good shape, and if you don't get obsessed with little things (the banged up wood on the wardrobe/tv cabinet, the bathroom door that didn't match anything, or the illfitting ceiling time in the bathroom, this does make for a viable alternative to the nearby high priced lodgings. All in all - definitely better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MelonsUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Hotel last November with a friend. Yes, it is a bit out of the way, but, as the weather was unseasonably warm last year, the walk to Harvard T station was pleasant and helped to work off the calories consumed at the Cheesecake Factory! The T is very convenient , cheap and safe. The hotel was clean and met all our needs. Breakfast was great and the waitress was very friendly, always interested in what we were doing the next day. We had a lovely view of the river, but we did have to hint that seeing as we had come all the way from the UK we might want a nice view! We were in Boston for shopping and sight seeing so didn't spend much time in the hotel. Days Hotel is great if you want a good price and a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but fairly clean”
Reviews.Author: brian61199
Reviews.Content: Overall the room was fairly clean but kind of run-down. As a guy, if I were traveling alone, I wouldn't mind staying here. However, don't come here if you are looking for a romantic experience. Our bathroom door wouldn't close and had tiles falling off the walls. That being said, the rest of the room was decent and they do appear to be doing renovations throughout the hotel. The neighborhood is decently safe but unattractive. I probably would not stay there again if I could find another hotel in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “way out!”
Reviews.Author: susandavis
Reviews.Content: Unless you are visiting someone at Harvard or do not eat, don't stay her. This hotel is OK but it is a $25 taxi ride into downtown Boston, there is a Chinese restaurant within the hotel which is very good but the only other eaterie within walking distance is McDonalds and there are certainly no watering holes! The bar is more like a staff room for the waiters who work in the restaurant and there is no fridge in the room, The computer is only set up for Wi-Fi so no internet access which for us was a problem as we needed to book our seats and print our boarding card. The only good thing about this hotel is the fact that the parking is very convenient and trouble free. They do a breakfast but we were told that this was only "acceptable" We were there for 3 nights, the first night was not a problem as we had to be up to start our travelling of New England but when we returned for the final two nights of the holiday we were well hacked off but luckily we had friends in Boston who came and rescued us and took us to a very nice Greek Restaruant about a 10min drive away and the second night we went to their home for a meal and that was definitely the highlight of our experience in Cambridge!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the location and price!”
Reviews.Author: BethUhhKnee
Reviews.Content: For the location and price it was a great deal. I booked a week or two before our trip and didn't want to spend hundreds of dollars when most of the time we wouldn't be in the hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Harvard square was a short 15 minute walk away as well as other public transport lines (buses and trains). For those who are looking for a clean, affordable, comfortable & safe place to stay I would recommend Days Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: wizbud
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite which was great although didn't have a river view. Everything very clean although a pervasive smell of the on site chinese restaurant was a bit off putting to start with. Nice bar and breakfast was good but we bought stuff in an ate in the suite. Supermarket across the road. Fantastic location just 20 mins walk from Harvard Square station and all that Cambridge has to offer..great restaurants.Could have been difficult to find but used Mapquest and all went well !

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't worth staying at, hopefully better now”
Reviews.Author: JimCem07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July of 2005 and can't believe all the good reviews. They must've done a major renovation. The 1st room we checked into had mold in the air conditioning so we had to move because of my wife's asthma; the 2nd room, the A/C did not work and the 3rd room we took just for the heck of it. And this was all after the front desk couldn't give us good directions to find the place. It took us 2 hours to find the place as they kept on saying, "Oh, you're just 15 minutes away." When we asked for management with all the room problems, one clerk portrayed himself as a manager but was not really. Management was hard to find; they eventually gave us a discount but wasn't worth all the hassle. I hope its better now.

Reviews.Title: “very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: harrisionsnanny
Reviews.Content: found the hotel to be excellent. the staff were very friendly and helpfull. the room we stayed in was very clean and cosy. the food in the resturant was lovely and found it to be good value for money. it was a bit of a long way out of town with no resturants nearby but we used the bus and cab to get to and from the city which was very affordable. thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “Modest facility, professional staff, very bad location”
Reviews.Author: jennijanich
Reviews.Content: This medium sized hotel is in the Brighton/Allston area of Boston across the river from Cambridge. The construction of the marginal roadways is such that if you are not familiar with the traffic patterns it can be very difficult to find this hotel, or to get to it if even you have a general idea of where it is but do not know the lay of the local roads. The roads are VERY POORLY labelled, very vaguely labelled. If you miss any of the the turn-offs from the 50 mph road, you wind up driving 10 to 15 minutes out of your way in either direction. I did not find that the hotel is easily visible except from the back end. If you miss the turn-off, reversing direction is not easy because it is necessary to either go back across the river, or to wind through the local streets. The local streets are maze-like with changing designations, and of course, you are contending with Boston drivers, notoriously ill-mannered, frenetic and impatient. One street changes from N to Q back to N. On the map it appears as if the street is continuous, however, in reality, the street is intersected by an overpass which requires cutting left, then right, then left. If you miss the change, which is easy, because the not all the streets are labelled, you wind up getting very lost. Some streets are triangular or curve leading to a dead end. The best way to get to his hotel is to drive to the far west end of Western Avenue and approach through the back parking lot. The hotel is located in a sort of "urban blight region". The front of the hotel faces the river, but the back is an old shopping mall and a light industrial zoning area. The parking lot is open to the the industrial area to the back so it gave me some pause about parking my car in the hotel parking area. Staff is very professional. Our room was extremely well cleaned and tidy. The condition of the room was somewhat worn but not atypical for Day's Inns. Mass transit access is actually by local bus. This might be convenient on the weekdays during work hours when the frequency is good, but on the weekends, it involves waiting at the bus stop for 20 to 60 minutes depending on how you time it. Walking to Cambridge from this hotel might be okay on a cooler day, but it was hot the day we stayed, and the path is essentially open "side of freeway" walking or walking through the backlots of industrial parks. I don't recommend this place to families because it doesn't feel safe. It's probably good for budget business travelers who don't mind using cabs, which are readily available at the front of the hotel. The money you might save on hotel fees and parking will be consumed by cab fare to and from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great nightly rate, but had security issues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Room was clean and comfortable. Security was an issue, as we had to have room keys reprogrammed about 4 different times, and were never asked for ID by front desk. Also the spare tire was stolen from our rental vehicle while parked in the parking garage. Got a great nightly rate, but probably won't stay there again because of security issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the weekend after Thanksgiving. Excellent value for money. It is a little bit outside of the city centre but it is easy to get a bus from right outside to Harvard T station and then straight into town. The rooms are perfect and have everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pool was perfect for my kids, while I could work out in the work out room. If I chose to, I could also swim laps. The rooms we large, and cleaned very well every day. If I had to go back to Boston, I would defintely go back to the Days Hotel in Boston, or maybe look into the Days Inn, which is down the road. My relatives stayed there, and said it was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ISandRVP
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Days Hotel in Boston. The room was clean and the front desk accommodating. Certainly, you get what you pay for, and, being one of the only places (and certainly the cheapest one) in Boston where I could get free parking, I must say this hotel was what we were looking for, though not a particularly lovely place. The neighborhood, if you can call it that, is empty of people and warehouse-y, and though it's only a 15 minute walk to Harvard Square, it's not a walk we wanted to do at night. Soldiers Field Road is the road on the western side of the city that snakes along the Charles River, and as it heads east, it becomes Storrow Drive. The divided road can make the hotel tricky to get into if you're coming from the east, though, with its bright Days Inn sign, it's certainly easy enough to find. If you pay a little extra you can get a view toward the river, which is nice. The hotel has a covered parking lot which is a great convenience and keeps you out of the weather - the lot is under the back building, which gives it a creepy feeling at night. (However, we encountered nothing that gave us any reason to feel that way.) Also, the hotel has a restaurant, but we didn't eat there as it was always totally empty. Carpets look a little worn throughout, but the bed was okay. TV has many channels, bathrooms were clean, with decent shampoos, etc. If you want a cheap base of operations and need a free place to put your car, this is a good hotel to consider. But if you're looking for something you'd call "nice," look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but far from the action”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirl
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed to discover how far out of town this hotel is. However, its only a 15 minute walk to the subway in Harvard Square, and that is preferrable to a $45 taxi ride! The hotel is clean and quiet, with a friendly bar atmospere in the evenings and an excellent breakfast is served. Four of us shared a room with 2 queen beds which was great value for money, although the breakfast was not included. Our kids enjoyed the swimming pool, which is in a safe enclosed area. I wouldnt go so far as to recommend this hotel to someone who wants easy access to Boston city centre, but its great if you want to include Harvard village in your tour.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A good place to stay if you don't mind driving or taking transit into the downtown area. Good value; the room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Polite and friendly staff. Free newspaper at your door each morning. Breakfast not included, but available in hotel's restaurant. McDonald's and other restaurants also within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service/location for budget travelers...”
Reviews.Author: kcemail2001
Reviews.Content: ...and Redsox fans! We arrived at this hotel specifically to attend two games at Fenway Park. What a deal! First, it is very accessible from the highway and offers free parking (even after we checked out and went to a day game). Second, a 10-15 minute walk puts you at the T station in Harvard Square. Third, within walking distance is nice park area on the Charles River and a great breakfast joint called The Breakfast Club (yes, named after the movie)--Not to mention all of the restaurants and what not in Harvard Square. The front desk staff, particularly Tony, was sweet as pie. Hotel has a clean pool, free Boston Globe Newspapers (yes even Sundayâ€™s), and cheap internet. By the way, although we took the T to/from the games, one night we took a taxi home from Fenway for $12. This is not the Ritz, but it is certainly not a dump or a disappointment. This hotel is an economical way to see the city, and the parking makes it all well worth the moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “A noisy hotel in a run down commercial location”
Reviews.Author: histman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special. It's a fairly long hike from Harvard Square and the buses are not very frequent. Make sure you are not located on the ice rink side or your sleep will be affected. Generally the place is pretty rundown. It is close to a Shaws, a Kmart and a McDonalds (v. poor - even for this chain) but next time we'll stay nearer the centre of Boston and pick a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: zaaaaaaaaaa
Reviews.Content: Don't expect much for this hotel---it was clean and good price. I took a trip to Boston in May 2004, basically only used to the room to sleep in which is what a trip is usually for. The people at the front desk were helpful, the room was nice for the price considering other boston hotels are WAY more expensive. So if you are looking for something cheap and just realy need a place to sleep, this place would be good.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the place was hard to find and the staff was nice, but the beds were horrible and the vending machines should have been an indication of the level of service

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StCirq
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room at the Days Hotel in Boston for two nights last week. A most disappointing experience. First of all, according to hotels, the hotel was very close to Boston University, our main destination in Boston - maybe as the crow flies, but not for visitors using public transportation. The hotel is on a stretch of Soldiers Field Road that is not near anything but old warehouses and commercial enterprises like a skating rink and a tow truck outfit. In order to get anywhere in Boston or Cambridge, it's necessary to take the #86 bus from behind to the hotel to either the Harvard redline stop or the Cleveland Circle greenline stop. The staff at the front desk were woefully ignorant of the local public transportation system. When we inquired how to get to Boston College, they said we should take the 86 bus to Cleveland Circle, then take the greenline into Kenmore station, switch to the B line, and go back out to BC. A quick review of an MBTA map showed that that was completely idiotic - the #86 bus crosses the B line one stop from BC. The hotel staff would have had us going all the way into the city on one line and all the way out on another for no reason. The hotel room was OK - spacious enough and with comfortable beds, but the walls were paper thin and we could hear every sound emanating from the room next door. Our bathroom door didn't close at all, and the tub and bathroom fixtures were stained and in need of repair. Breakfast at the hotel was a disaster. Although there were only a total of perhaps 12 people in the dining room, we waited 20 minutes for someone to take our order, it took 45 minutes for the food to come, and we didn't get some things we had ordered. The waitress kept telling us "it's a zoo here this morning!" but there was no evidence of anything unusual at all. By the time we finished our meal, other customers were yelling at the manager and calling the service "scandalous." I would never stay at this hotel again, and would not recommend that anyone do so.

Reviews.Title: “don't plan on getting any sleep here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveldiva23
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and had no problems. however, i can't say the same about my stay this time. i was unable to get any sleep here and that is coming from someone who lives in manhattan! we were placed in the back part of the hotel. we overlooked the boston public works area which to say the least is an unpleasant view. even though it was the end of may the temperature dropped into the 30's at night. our room was freezing and the heat did not work. we called the front desk about it and they said they didn't know how the heat works or if it would be coming on but we could have some blankets. that was the least of our problems. as the night went on we could hear everything going on in the rooms next to us and in the hallway. we were kept up all night. people were in the hallways and slamming doors. to top it all off at 6am on sunday morning, we had tractors and dumptrucks working underneath our window at the boston works department although we were assured by the staff at the front desk when we checked in that our room was in a quiet location. we voiced our disatisfaction to the front desk and they were able to switch us into a room in the main part of the hotel where we had originally wanted a room. the walls were still thin but at least we didn't have to hear tractors and trucks. so if you are planning to stay at this hotel, request a room in the main part of the hotel. or better yet, stay somewhere else. there are plenty of other hotels in the boston area which have thicker walls and are in a quieter location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms but Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: This hotel is reasonably priced, recently renovated, and situated close to Harvard with a view of the Charles River. The rooms are also clean and well appointed. Cons: Be forewarned, that some of the rooms may have very thin walls. We were awakened at 2:30 a.m. by folks returning to their room next door. Although initially there was some loud laughter and raised voices, we continued to be kept awake by our neighbors who were simply talking, not yelling, to each other. We could follow and hear their entire conversation, in addition to their going to the bathroom, not just the flushing. There was a real problem with the noise dampening, or lack thereof, of the walls. We would suggest that you request empty rooms on both sides of your room, if that is at all possible. To be fair, after we contacted the managment about the problem, they effectively notified and quieted the offending party, and thereafter reduced our room charge by 25%. Although my children finally got back to sleep about 4:00 a.m., we were awakened early the next morning by the maid vacuuming the other room next door. It doesn't pay to hang your "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door.

Reviews.Title: “how to get there without a car!”
Reviews.Author: Quantumdot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, staff friendly, view is great if you are on the right side of the hotel, but there is so much to see that you won't be relying on having a great view. Very good price, quiet location. The only minor problem was getting there the first time, no instructions on their website as to how to get there on public transport. You can get a detailed map of the MBTA public transport system from the information kiosk at South station on the main concourse. Take metro to get on the red line (outbound direction Alewife) and take this up to either Central Square or Harvard Square. I only know the Harvard Square bus stop so I only describe that here. From Harvard Square follow directions for the no.86 bus, once outside need to go towards the park (towards a big sign Sheraton, in the distance) and be on that side of the road. There is a bus stop for 86 and 66 near some stone slabs which describe the history of Harvard Sq., further on is the park. The 86 is direction Cleveland Circle. The 86 bus will take you to the back entrance of the Days Hotel, ring the bell when Mcdonalds sign comes to view, you are on Western Avenue and the hotel is just to the right (~10 minute journey). You can walk through the carpark right through to Soldiers Field Rd, which has the nice view of the river. From Central Square you can catch the 70 or 70A. (bus fare is 90c) Once you have arrived ask for a bus time table. Alternatively you can walk from Harvard Square, it is 15 minutes, go along Western Avenue, not Soldiers Rd.!! It is very easy when you know how!! Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a beautiful view of the Charles River, we watched the crews rowing each day. It was very affordable, within walking distance of Harvard Univeristy and a very friendly staff treated you like a VIP but was also very professional. The restaurant was a pleasant surprise and there was free parking! Overall, a great experience! I would definitely recommend this hotel!
